transcript.text: Which mural sketch keeps the viewer focused on the community story?
The design with the diagonal lines pulls my eye to the center.
I like the version with bright neon arrows even if it is off theme.
Neon arrows scream electric festival, not the neighborhood story.
But the arrows would look amazing on the basketball court wall!
Bring it back—how do the arrows support or distract from our goal?
They distract because they compete with the portraits.
Keeping the focal point on neighborhood faces tells the story better.
Exactly. Note that observation for our design brief.
